title: (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No.
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Housing, Local Government and Heritage
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Housing, Local Government and Heritage 

(Delegation of Ministerial Functions) (No. 2) Order 2020.
text_norm: 1 order may cited housing local government heritage (delegation ministerial functions) (no 2) order 2020

title: (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No.
heading: 2. The powers (other than the power to prosecute an offence) and duties of
text_raw:
2. The powers (other than the power to prosecute an offence) and duties of 
the Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage, conferred on him – 

(a) by or under the Acts of the Oireachtas or statutes which were in 
force in Saorstát Éireann immediately before the date of the 
coming into operation of the Constitution and which continued in 
force by virtue of Article 50 of the Constitution specified in Part 
1 of the Schedule, 

(b) by or under the provisions of the Acts of the Oireachtas specified 

in Part 2 of the Schedule, and 

(c) 

under the instruments specified in Part 3 of the Schedule, 

are delegated to Malcolm Noonan, Minister of State at the Department of 
Housing, Local Government and Heritage. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 5th January, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [747] 3
text_norm: 2 power (other power prosecute offence) duty minister housing local government heritage conferred - (a) act oireachtas statute force saorstat eireann immediately date coming operation constitution continued force virtue article 50 constitution specified part 1 schedule (b) provision act oireachtas specified part 2 schedule (c) instrument specified part 3 schedule delegated malcolm noonan minister state department housing local government heritage notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 5th january 2021 747 3

title: (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No.
heading: Seanad Electoral (University Members) Act 1937 (No. 30 of 1937), other than
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 

Part 1 

Seanad Electoral (University Members) Act 1937 (No. 30 of 1937), other than 

sections 12, 13 and 19 

Seanad Electoral (Panel Members) Act 1947 (No. 42 of 1947), other than 

sections 24(1), Part V Chapter 1 and section 68A 

Electoral Act 1992 (No. 23 of 1992), other than sections 8, 30, 56(2), 57, Part 

XII, sections 96, 108, 109, 127(2), Part XXI, section 164 and the Third Schedule 

Presidential Elections Act 1993 (No. 28 of 1993), other than sections 6, 8, 9, 

10(2), 12, 28, 29, 31, 56 and Part V 

Referendum Act 1994 (No. 12 of 1994), other than sections 10 to 12, 14, 15(2), 

18, 24 and Part IV 

European Parliament Elections Act 1997 (No. 2 of 1997), other than sections 

10, 15, 15A, 16, 17(4) and 21 and rules 1, 21, 22, 27, 69, 70, 92(3) and 130 to 
146 of the 

Second Schedule 

Local Elections (Disclosure of Donations and Expenditure) Act 1999 (No. 7 of 

1999), other than sections 12B and 19C 

Irish Church Act 1869 (32 & 33 Vict. c. 42) 

Saint Stephen's Green (Dublin) Act 1877 (40 & 41 Vict. c. cxxxiv) 

Phoenix Park Act 1925 (No. 31 of 1925) 

National Monuments Act 1930 (No. 2 of 1930) 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [747] 

Bourn Vincent Memorial Park Act 1932 (No. 31 of 1932) 

Whale Fisheries Act 1937 (No. 4 of 1937) 

National Monuments (Amendment) Act 1954 (No. 37 of 1954) 

Holycross Abbey (County Tipperary) Act 1969 (No. 7 of 1969) 

Wildlife Act 1976 (No. 39 of 1976) (other than Sections 26 (3), 32, 34 (3)(b)) 

Canals Act 1986 (No. 3 of 1986) 

National Monuments (Amendment) Act 1987 (No. 17 of 1987) 

Shannon Navigation Act 1990 (No. 20 of 1990) 

National Monuments (Amendment) Act 1994 (No. 17 of 1994) 

Heritage Act 1995 (No. 4 of 1995) other than Section 5 

Architectural Heritage 
(Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 1999 (No. 19 of 1999) 

(National 

Inventory) and Historic Monuments 

Wildlife (Amendment) Act 2000 (No. 38 of 2000) 

Heritage Fund Act 2001 (No. 44 of 2001) 

National Monuments (Amendment) Act 2004 (No. 22 of 2004) 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [747] 5 

Part 2 

Part VII of the Electoral Act 1997 (No. 25 of 1997) 

Section 14 of the Irish Land Act 1903 (3 Edw. 7 c. 37) 

Section 2(2) of the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) Act 1928 (No. 6 of 
1928) in so far as it relates to the Royal Botanic Gardens 

Section 15A(b) of the Roads Act 1993 (No. 14 of 1993) 

Section 482 of the Taxes Consolidation Act 1997 (No. 39 of 1997) 

Sections 2, 3 and 5 (in so far as it relates to the functions referred to in that 
section transferred by the Heritage (Transfer of Departmental Administration 
and Ministerial Functions) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 339 of 2020) and the Inland 
Waterways and Waterways Ireland (Transfer of Departmental and Ministerial 
Functions) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 340 of 2020)) of the Minister for Arts, Heritage, 
Gaeltacht and the Islands (Powers and Functions) Act 1998 (No. 7 of 1998) 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [747] 

Part 3 

Local Elections Regulations 1995 (S.I. No. 297 of 1995) other than regulations 
24, 25 and 90 

European Union (Citizens’ Initiative) Regulations 2012 and 2014 

European Union (Citizens’ Initiative) Regulations 2019 (S.I. No. 648 of 2019) 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Government, 

22 December, 2020. 

MICHEÁL MARTIN, 

Taoiseach. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [747] 7
